title: Clean up cast
text:
Cruise WS15320 stn9_5
TODO: upate to use OCE package & code from https://github.com/Mostafaawada/Dissertation_code/blob/main/analysis/cast_cleanup.qmd


setup
  if (!nzchar(system.file(package = "librarian"))) {
    install.packages("librarian")
  }

  librarian::shelf(
    quiet = TRUE,
    readr, here, glue, "jiho/castr", dplyr
  )




load data file
fpath <- here(glue(
  "data/01_raw/{params$cruise_id}/{params$cruise_id}_{params$station_id}.csv"
))

ctd_station_df <- read_csv(fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)




plot data using ctd_plotting.R
source(here("R/ctd_plotting.R"))
  salinity <-
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_salinity,
      xlab = "Practical salinity",
      .color = "darkgreen"
    )
  
  # temperature
  temp <- 
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_temperature,
      xlab = expression(~Temperature ~ (degree ~ C))
  )

  # combine salinity and temperature
  combined_plot <- cowplot::plot_grid(salinity, temp, nrow = 1)


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


plot data using ctd_plotting.R
  print(combined_plot)







plot data like castr example
ggplot(ctd_station_df) + geom_path(aes(x=sea_water_temperature, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)







despike the data using castr
ctd_clean <- ctd_station_df %>% group_by(time) %>%
  mutate(temp=despike(sea_water_temperature, mult=3))

ggplot(ctd_clean) + geom_path(aes(x=temp, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)

TODO: upate to use OCE package & code from https://github.com/Mostafaawada/Dissertation_code/blob/main/analysis/cast_cleanup.qmd


setup
  if (!nzchar(system.file(package = "librarian"))) {
    install.packages("librarian")
  }

  librarian::shelf(
    quiet = TRUE,
    readr, here, glue, "jiho/castr", dplyr
  )




load data file
fpath <- here(glue(
  "data/01_raw/{params$cruise_id}/{params$cruise_id}_{params$station_id}.csv"
))

ctd_station_df <- read_csv(fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)




plot data using ctd_plotting.R
source(here("R/ctd_plotting.R"))
  salinity <-
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_salinity,
      xlab = "Practical salinity",
      .color = "darkgreen"
    )
  
  # temperature
  temp <- 
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_temperature,
      xlab = expression(~Temperature ~ (degree ~ C))
  )

  # combine salinity and temperature
  combined_plot <- cowplot::plot_grid(salinity, temp, nrow = 1)


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: pseudoinverse used at -26.953


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: neighborhood radius 0.0001


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: reciprocal condition number 0


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: There are other near singularities as well. 1e-08

Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: pseudoinverse used at -26.953


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: neighborhood radius 0.0001


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: reciprocal condition number 0


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: There are other near singularities as well. 1e-08


plot data using ctd_plotting.R
  print(combined_plot)







plot data like castr example
ggplot(ctd_station_df) + geom_path(aes(x=sea_water_temperature, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)







despike the data using castr
ctd_clean <- ctd_station_df %>% group_by(time) %>%
  mutate(temp=despike(sea_water_temperature, mult=3))

ggplot(ctd_clean) + geom_path(aes(x=temp, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)

TODO: upate to use OCE package & code from https://github.com/Mostafaawada/Dissertation_code/blob/main/analysis/cast_cleanup.qmd


setup
  if (!nzchar(system.file(package = "librarian"))) {
    install.packages("librarian")
  }

  librarian::shelf(
    quiet = TRUE,
    readr, here, glue, "jiho/castr", dplyr
  )




load data file
fpath <- here(glue(
  "data/01_raw/{params$cruise_id}/{params$cruise_id}_{params$station_id}.csv"
))

ctd_station_df <- read_csv(fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)




plot data using ctd_plotting.R
source(here("R/ctd_plotting.R"))
  salinity <-
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_salinity,
      xlab = "Practical salinity",
      .color = "darkgreen"
    )
  
  # temperature
  temp <- 
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_temperature,
      xlab = expression(~Temperature ~ (degree ~ C))
  )

  # combine salinity and temperature
  combined_plot <- cowplot::plot_grid(salinity, temp, nrow = 1)


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: pseudoinverse used at -23.59


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: neighborhood radius 0.0001


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: reciprocal condition number 0


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: There are other near singularities as well. 4e-08

Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: pseudoinverse used at -23.59


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: neighborhood radius 0.0001


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: reciprocal condition number 0


Warning in simpleLoess(y, x, w, span, degree = degree, parametric = parametric,
: There are other near singularities as well. 4e-08


plot data using ctd_plotting.R
  print(combined_plot)







plot data like castr example
ggplot(ctd_station_df) + geom_path(aes(x=sea_water_temperature, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)







despike the data using castr
ctd_clean <- ctd_station_df %>% group_by(time) %>%
  mutate(temp=despike(sea_water_temperature, mult=3))

ggplot(ctd_clean) + geom_path(aes(x=temp, y=-sea_water_pressure, group=time), alpha=0.6)

setup
  if (!nzchar(system.file(package = "librarian"))) {
    install.packages("librarian")
  }

  librarian::shelf(
    quiet = TRUE,
    readr, here, glue, "jiho/castr", dplyr
  )




load data file
fpath <- here(glue(
  "data/01_raw/{params$cruise_id}/{params$cruise_id}_{params$station_id}.csv"
))

ctd_station_df <- read_csv(fpath, show_col_types = FALSE)




plot data using ctd_plotting.R
source(here("R/ctd_plotting.R"))
  salinity <-
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_salinity,
      xlab = "Practical salinity",
      .color = "darkgreen"
    )
  
  # temperature
  temp <- 
    ctd_plotting(
      ctd_station_df,
      sea_water_pressure,
      sea_water_temperature,
      xlab = expression(~Temperature ~ (degree ~ C))
  )

  # combine salinity and temperature
  combined_plot <- cowplot::plot_grid(salinity, temp, nrow = 1)
